etymology.description: 金(金) (jīn, "gold"), 竹(竹) (zhú, "bamboo"), 果(果) (guǒ, "fruit")
etymology.interpretation: 金竹果 (jīn zhú guǒ) combines 金(金) (jīn, "gold"), 竹(竹) (zhú, "bamboo"), and 果(果) (guǒ, "fruit") to describe a fruit, possibly metaphorically referred to as the 'golden bamboo fruit'. This may reflect the color, value, or uniqueness of the fruit in question.
